Message.Title: Yahoo Said to Plan Board Shake-Up, Adding Levchin of PayPal
Message.Msg: Yahoo is poised to announce changes to its board, including the addition of Max Levchin, a former senior executive at PayPal, people briefed on the matter said. The board is also expected to announce the departure of two current directors: Brad Smith, the former chief executive of Intuit and David W. Kenny, the chief executive of the Weather Channel. The shake-up is expected to be announced within days, these people said. Yahoo did not respond to requests for comment.

Message.Title: Yahoo is the internet content king
Message.Msg: Yahoo always has been the internet content king. The problem is getting the right technology to back them up and distribute them online and on smart phones. Also, I found the functions were not connected well before. I hope that Marisa will improve all these fronts and do Yahoo right. I think Jerry and the gang had the right ideas, they were ahead of their time in the late 1990s and realize that Yahoo can bring value by social networking. The only problem is that Yahoo failed to execute its vision through technology and did not acquired key companies to help them. Marisa seems to be able to do that so far.... I think that if all pieces are together, one can expect Yahoo to move quickly.. stock price, that is.

Message.Title: Balance Sheet Problem
Message.Msg: They wrote up there cash on the sale of Alibaba but forgot to minus it off there long term investments. It makes it look like there stock holders equity is up $3.5 billion when it is actually neutral. Its like if my car and my house are worth $150 000 and I sell my car for $50 000. I am still only worth $150 000 right? You dont just add the $50 000 in cash to the $150 000. They will have to write this off.

Topic.Title: A couple of quarters of increasing revenue will make msft and/or apple take out yhoo in 2013

Message.Msg: Why exactly would either of those companies pay DOUBLE based on increasing revenue? Yahoo last I checked had $8.4B on the books of which $2B will go to Uncle Sam in taxes for AG. Their stake in Yahoo Japan is $7.5B, let's say, and just like AG it gets knocked to $5B. That leaves the AG stake and we'll be generous there as well...10% at say $70B IPO valuation is $7B knocked down to $4.5B. Cash-$6.4B once Uncle Sam takes his cut Yahoo Japan-$5B once Uncle Sam takes his cut AG 10% at IPO-$4.5B AG 13% let's say is worth $13B AFTER-TAX on a $150B company =$28.9/1.2B shares is $24 per share You want $11+ per share more or $13.2B for the core which is 3X its revenues Up to $16 per share or $19.2B for the core which is almost 5X its revenues ***No business will sell for MULTIPLES over its revenue cause if you say it makes $1B+ that investment will pay for itself in 15-20yrs. Why would anyone do that? Even if you say they could miraculously DOUBLE the profit it'd still be a decade before you get your money back and that is me being generous in everything they could get out of AG.
